title: Harry Maguire in coin toss blunder as Man Utd captain goes missing before game
text:

Harry Maguire was understandably excited ahead of Manchester United's Europa League clash with Partizan Belgrade on Thursday evening.

After all, it was a big occasion for the £80million summer sighing, playing in his inaugural European fixture and, perhaps more impressively, wearing the captain's armband for the very first time.

But his inexperience in wearing said armband was there for the world to see just seconds into the group game when he forgot to stick around for the coin toss.

BT Sport cameras captured Partizan skipper and goalkeeper Vladimir Stojkovic waiting patiently for the England international to join him at the centre circle.

(Image: BT Sport)

And when he failed to arrive, the referee and his assistants were forced to wave Maguire over to take part in the coin toss and exchange pennants.

Maguire quickly realised his error and jogged over to the middle of the pitch where he shook hands with the Partizan captain.

The coin toss then took place before the game got underway.

(Image: BT Sport)

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer said all the way back in September that Maguire has the qualities to skipper the Red Devils but has waited until now to make him captain.

"He does, definitely. It's already been in my head, thinking about him as a future captain," the United boss said previously.

"On the pitch he's a leader. He stands on the ball when we need to slow it down, he defends well, he's got this presence in both boxes and off the pitch he is a top professional.

(Image: BT Sport)

"He's vocal - he voices his opinion at training and in the dressing room - and I'm very pleased with the money we've spent on him.

"He hasn't asked [to be captain] yet! But it's been in my head that he can wear the armband."
description: The referee and his assistants had to call the Manchester United captain over to join them at the centre circle
